alert.note: Alert for Elkhead and Park Mountains; South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet; West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued December 12 at 3:11PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE COLORADO AVALANCHE INFORMATION CENTER. The Colorado Avalanche Information Center has issued an AVALANCHE WARNING for the following areas: * WHAT... The avalanche danger will rise to HIGH (Level 4 of 5) on Tuesday and Wednesday. * WHERE... Park Range, Medicine Bow Mountains, Never Summer Mountains, and the Northern Front Range including Rocky Mountain National Park. * WHEN... Expect very dangerous avalanche conditions on Tuesday December 13 and Wednesday December 14. * IMPACTS... Large avalanches will run naturally. Large and dangerous avalanches will be very easy to trigger. * PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Travel in backcountry avalanche terrain is not recommended on Tuesday and Wednesday. Avoid travel on and under slopes with a slope angle greater than about 30 degrees. You can find more detailed information at colorado.gov/avalanche. Cooperstein
